place.name: LITTLE BARNINGHAM
place.gazetteerText: BARNINGHAM (Little), or Barningham-Parva, a parish in Aylsham district, Norfolk; 5½ miles NNW of Aylsham, and 13 E by N of Ryburgh r. station. Post Town, Itteringham, under Norwich. Acres, 1,224. Real property, £1,373. Pop., 273. Houses, 54. The property is divided among a few. A market and a fair were formerly held here, under charter of Edward I. to Walter de Berningham, lord of the manor. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £180. Patrons, G. D. Graver, T. L. Graver, and G. B. Knight, Esqrs. The church is old but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
